definition: Ganden monastery, Tibetan: dGa' ldan rNam rgyal gling, Dagzê county 達孜縣|达孜县[Da2 zi1 xian4], Lhasa, Tibet
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
red/pellet/powder/cinnabar
Buddhist temple/mosque/government office (old)

sentences.english: Ambassador and Mrs. Huntsman pause to view a yak butter candle at Ganden Monastery.
sentences.chinese: 洪博培大使及夫人在甘丹寺內駐足觀看犛牛酥油蠟燭。

sentences.english: And haven't the chance for Gaden Ladrang.
sentences.chinese: 但是，卻沒有機會爲甘丹寺的詹拉章。

sentences.english: I don't have house in Gaden anymore so it will be necessary.
sentences.chinese: 我在甘丹寺並沒有自己的家，因此它是有必要的。

definition: Drepung monastery, Lhasa, Tibet
Sera monastery near Lhasa, Tibet
Gelugpa school of Tibetan Buddhism
Jokhang, main Buddhist temple in Lhasa, a sacred place of Tibetan Buddhism
Labrang monastery, Tibetan: bLa-brang bkra-shis-'khyil, in Xiahe county 夏河縣|夏河县[Xia4 he2 xian4], Gannan Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Gansu, formerly Amdo province of Tibet
Lhagang temple in Dartsendo county 康定縣|康定县[Kang1 ding4 xian4], Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Sichuan
Potala, winter palace of Dalai Lamas in Lhasa, Tibet
Geju (Tibetan: transmit word of Buddha) sect of Tibetan Buddhist
Tibetan Buddhism
Kumbum (Chinese Ta'er), monastery in Qinhai, formerly Amdo province of Tibet
Tsongkhapa (1357-1419), Tibetan religious leader, founder of the Gelugpa school 格魯派|格鲁派[Ge2 lu3 pai4]
Ramoche Temple, Lhasa
Panchen (Lama)/abbr. for 班禪額爾德尼|班禅额尔德尼[Ban1 chan2 E2 er3 de2 ni2]
Norbulingka (Tibetan: precious garden), summer residence of Dalai Lamas in Lhasa, Tibet
Panchen Erdeni or Panchen Lama/abbr. to 班禪|班禅[Ban1 chan2]
pinyin: Ban1 chan2 E2 er3 de2 ni2

definition: lamasery/temple of Tibetan Buddhism
